descript.abstract: Assessor's parcel data for town of Randolph, MA. Developed from existing digital data. Geometry and attributes updated on May 2019.

idinfo.accconst: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
idinfo.useconst: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.
idinfo.native: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in a file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database, and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.
idinfo.datacred: Applied Geographics, Boston, MA; Town of Randolph Planning Dept., Randolph, MA

citeinfo.title: Data for town of Randolph, MA, complying with Level 3 of MassGIS digital parcel standard
citeinfo.origin: Town of Randolph Planning Dept., Randolph, MA

dataqual.logic: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

Total number of parcels = 9266 Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.8 pct Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0 pct
Total number of records in assessor table = 10331 Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 9633 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID that join to tax parcels: 9623 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.9 pct High value match rate passes QA.
Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 698 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID join to tax parcels: 684 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL and OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 98.0 pct Low value match rate passes QA.
Checking match rate of parcels to assessor list... --------------------------------------------- Required match rate for 9242 parcels: 99.0 pct Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE and NO_MATCH = "N": 9208 Of these, 9164 join to assessor list. Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.5 pct Parcel to assessor match rate is ok. Passes QA.

horizpa.horizpar: Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

srcinfo.srccontr: Source data is in ESRI personal geodatabase format. Original automation was from 75 hardcopy maps at 1"=100' , completed in 2008.

procstep.procdesc: Existing GIS parcel data was converted to MassGIS Level 3 template geodatabase and additional data layers and tables were added.
Spatial accuracy of data was verified using the parcel standard guidelines; town boundary was verified to be coincident with MassGIS town Boundary layer. Polygon topology was updated and validated.

Multipart polygons were created where necessary; internal polygon boundaries were dissolved where necessary; polygons representing legal boundaries such as easements or private right-of-ways were created. LOC_ID was generated or updated.

Updates were made to the Level II data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of May 2011 for the town's FY 2012. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.

Overlay errors between TaxPar and OthLeg were corrected. Multilink errors between TaxPar and Assess were verified or corrected. Lotsize discrepancies between shape area in TaxPar and LOTSIZE in Assess were verified or corrected.
Original parcel polygon attributes retained, in addition to TaxPar attributes required for Level 3 conformance.
Geometry and attributes updated March 2017. Parcels were edited according to splits, merges, and other changes required by the Randolph assessing department.

Updates were made to the Level III data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of January 2019 for the town's FY 2020. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.

overview.dsoverv: Parcel data for the town of Randolph, MA. FY 2012 annual parcel updates were done in January 2012. Data was then upgraded to MassGIS Level III standards. Data represents boundaries of approximately 9200 properties, and corresponding information from the town's records of property assessment, including property address, use code and value. Property boundaries are current as of January 2012; property record information is current as of December 2011, and represent data for the the town's fiscal year 2012.
overview.eaover:
For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.0.
http://www.mass.gov/mgis/standards.htm#Parstandard

distinfo.distliab: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.

onlinopt.accinstr: Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.

distinfo.custom: Upon compliance with level 3 of the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files, this data will be made available for download on the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis/parcels.htm
distinfo.resdesc: M244TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Randolph, MA that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M244Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M244OthLeg and M244Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/mgis/stratplan.html), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

distorCont.rpOrgName: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts

onLineSrc.orDesc: Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.

M244TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Randolph, MA that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M244Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M244OthLeg and M244Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/mgis/stratplan.html), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.

report.measDesc: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

Total number of parcels = 9266 Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.8 pct Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0 pct Total number of records in assessor table = 10331 Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 9633 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID that join to tax parcels: 9623 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.9 pct High value match rate passes QA. Total records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 698 Of these, total records with valid LOC_ID join to tax parcels: 684 Match rate for parcels where BLDG_VAL and OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 98.0 pct Low value match rate passes QA. Checking match rate of parcels to assessor list... --------------------------------------------- Required match rate for 9242 parcels: 99.0 pct Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE and NO_MATCH = "N": 9208 Of these, 9164 join to assessor list. Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.5 pct Parcel to assessor match rate is ok. Passes QA.

Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

prcStep.stepDesc: Existing GIS parcel data was converted to MassGIS Level 3 template geodatabase and additional data layers and tables were added.
Spatial accuracy of data was verified using the parcel standard guidelines; town boundary was verified to be coincident with MassGIS town Boundary layer. Polygon topology was updated and validated.

Overlay errors between TaxPar and OthLeg were corrected. Multilink errors between TaxPar and Assess were verified or corrected. Lotsize discrepancies between shape area in TaxPar and LOTSIZE in Assess were verified or corrected.
Original parcel polygon attributes retained, in addition to TaxPar attributes required for Level 3 conformance.

Multipart polygons were created where necessary; internal polygon boundaries were dissolved where necessary; polygons representing legal boundaries such as easements or private right-of-ways were created. LOC_ID was generated or updated.

Updates were made to the Level II data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of May 2011 for the town's FY 2012. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.

Updates were made to the Level III data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of January 2019 for the town's FY 2020. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.
Geometry and attributes updated March 2017. Parcels were edited according to splits, merges, and other changes required by the Randolph assessing department.

dataSource.srcDesc: Source data is in ESRI personal geodatabase format. Original automation was from 75 hardcopy maps at 1"=100' , completed in 2008.

prcStep.stepDesc: Updates were made to the Level III data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of January 2021 for the town's FY 2022. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.

Updates were made to the Level III data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of January 2022 for the town's FY 2023. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.

Updates were made to the Level III data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of January 2024 for the town's FY 2025. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.

Updates were made to the Level III data to reflect the most current version of the town's tax maps as of January 2025 for the town's FY 2026. CAMA data was matched against parcel data to produce a mismatch report which was reconciled with the help of the town. Final QA/QC tool was run.
